intro: Cabralea brachystachya, commonly known as the short-stalked cabralea, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically ovate and have a rough, hairy texture. Cabralea brachystachya is often found in humid, shaded environments within cloud forests.
